job.title: Software Engineer - Java and Angular Application Developer
job.description:
Job Description
Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
Wealth and Investment Management Technology is seeking a Software Engineer/Applications Developer with strong background in Java and Angular development. This position will be part of a Java development team building and supporting enterprise applications. In this role you will design, develop, and support Java applications for the Wealth and Trust businesses. The ideal candidate will have good communication skills, possess good problem solving skills, and work well in a team.
Key Responsibilities Include
Design, develop and maintain enterprise class mission critical web applications for Wealth & Trust business domains
Contribute in all aspects of application development life cycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support)
Writing high quality & high performance code with high level of test coverage
Adhering to Software Development Life-cycle policies, procedures and standards
Ensuring applications adhere to all Wells Fargo policies, vulnerability management and technology updates
Improving processes and automating to make them simpler, faster, and more secure
Act as senior developer supporting other developers and provide technical direction to less experienced staff
Interact with business teams to review, analyze, design and implement solutions that meet the business need
Ensure documentation on architecture, processes and systems changes are up to date
Collaborate with other teams & team members to design, implement and maintain software solutions
Be part of high-performing agile team with ability to flex according to project needs
Continuously learn to improve skills and staying current on technology trends
Required Qualifications
5+ years of software engineering experience
5+ years of Java experience
1+ year of experience developing with Angular 7 and above application
3+ years of experience with databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL server, or Teradata
2+ years of experience with Spring, Spring Batch, and Spring Boot
2+ years of experience with one or a combination of the following: RESTful, JSON or XML web-based services
1+ year of Agile experience
Desired Qualifications
An industry-standard technology certification
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
A BS/BA degree or higher in science or technology
Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing
1+ year of Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) experience
Messaging Queue (MQ) experience
Knowledge and understanding of Selenium software testing framework
Knowledge and understanding of application testing methodologies, tools, and execution
Knowledge of widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games
Brokerage or wealth management experience
Job Expectations
Ability to work additional hours as needed
Ability to work on call as assigned
Flexibility to work in a 24/7 environment, including weekends and holidays
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.
Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
